sect1.title: Overview
sect1.para: Desktop applications today are either working with data files or can be enhanced by them, or both. The interchange of those files between users of said applications is however not standardised. This specification covers a way to let users upload and download their data files and thus share them with each other.

sect1.title: A unified scheme for data sharing
sect1.para: Based on the existing GHNS ("Get Hot New Stuff") framework, which exists with implementations for KDE and SDL, and the XML format used for downloads of AGO (art.gnome.org), a unified, generic sharing framework is proposed to be implemented by all free desktops.

sect1.title: Providers
sect1.para: In order to find a place to host files and download files from, a directory service-like request is done first. This is implemented by a so-called provider resource, an XML file which lists all of the available providers with its upload and download URLs, icon, web access URL and (internationalised) name. Not all of thoese attributes have to be given, it is however recommended to implement all of them to achieve a higher usability.
See the appendix 'Provider DTD' for more details.

sect1.title: Upload format
sect1.para: Upload data includes information about authorship (author name and email), the data part itself (payload, preview and summary) as well as meta information: version, release number, release date and license.
See the appendix 'Upload DTD' for more details.

sect1.title: Download format
sect1.para: In the download specification both the meta data given by the author of the contribution and the data aggregated by the web server is contained. One such file may list one or more items.
See the appendix 'Download DTD' for more details.

sect1.title: Meta-data
sect1.para: The rating is a value between 0 and 100, with 0 meaning lowest and 100 meaning highest level of appreciation.

sect1.title: Data item types
sect1.para: Every data item is assigned a specific type. How those are related to MIME types will be shown here.

sect1.title: Licenses
sect1.para: The following license abbreviations are recognised and be linked to automatically. If another license is chosen, the URL to the text should be given and the license abbreviation field should be left empty.
gpl - GNU General Public License bsd - BSD-style license publicdomain - Works in the public domain ...
